snippet: A former darling of the start-up world, the company offers a glimpse of what some of today’s biggest start-ups might look like several years down the road.
abstract: Start-up LivingSocial, which briefly prospered with its daily email coupon business and was valued at $4.5 billion, offers lesson on what might happen to unicorns if they falter; online marketplace offering discounts at local businesses has lost money in recent years, with $100 million loss in 2014.

byline.original: By MIKE ISAAC and KATIE BENNER
byline.contributor: Mike Isaac reported from Washington and Katie Benner from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: A former darling of the start-up world, the company offers a glimpse of what some of today’s biggest start-ups might look like several years down the road.

headline.main: LivingSocial Offers a Cautionary Tale to Today’s Unicorns
headline.print_headline: When Start-Ups Fly Too Close to the Sun
